isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - LIFT AXLE SYSTEMS - SYSTEM OPERATION - Auto Lift in Reverse Feature (Self-Steering Systems Only)

svcproc.title: Auto Lift in Reverse Feature (Self-Steering Systems Only)

warning.para: To avoid property damage, personal injury, or possible death; be aware of the Auto-Lift in Reverse feature on trucks with self-steering lift axles. On trucks with self-steering lift axles, any axle that is in the DOWN position when reverse is selected, will automatically raise to its UP position; AND that axle will automatically return to the down position when the transmission is shifted out of reverse.

svcproc.para: The self-steer lift axles are not designed to be in the down position while the truck is backing. Therefore, on vehicles with self-steer axles, when the transmission is shifted into reverse, all lowered axles will automatically be raised to the up position, and the indicators on all of the lift axle switches will turn off. Shifting the transmission out of reverse will return power to the system, turning on the indicator on the AXLE ENABLE switch. If an axle UP/DOWN switch is in the DOWN position its indicator will also turn on and that axle will automatically be lowered to its down position.
